> *nityo nityānāṁ cetanaś cetanānām*
>
> "The Supreme Being is one, maintaining all others; He is the supreme living consciousness among all living consciousnesses."

The essence of this verse is that among the countless eternal living beings (both in the material and spiritual worlds, in conditioned and liberated states), there is one supreme, eternal, conscious being. Besides these two, there is the greatest living soul, the Lord himself, who has entered the material world and is sustaining it. The spiritual world is made of the same nature as the infallible living beings. **nityo nityānāṁ cetanaś cetanānām**"
    >
    > **💬 Purport by Srila Prabhupada:** This verse is explained in the Katha Upanishad (2.2.13) and Shvetashvatara Upanishad (6.13).
